adrFormatAddress: 30 River Rd, New York, NY 10044, USA

originalText.text: We loved living at Manhattan park. The leasing office staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. Rent and Danielle helped us coordinate moving in and moving out. Our doorman and maintenance guys became our friends. The apartments are spacious, updated and clean. Most apartments here seem to bring in good light too. If we ever had a problem, maintenance was there within 24hrs. Each building has a gym which usually isn’t crowded. Manhattan park even partners with organizations to host fun holiday events like for Halloween and Christmas. If you’re on the fence about moving here, do it. The red bus takes you to and from the station with ease!

originalText.text: I recently leased an apartment at Manhattan Park and I can't help but rave about how wonderful the process was, from the initial visit, to the lease process, to moving in. Liz, my lease agent and her colleague Remy went out of their way to be helpful in answering my questions and completing the lease process. I have found the building management team to be quite efficient and helpful as well. I had three minor issues that needed to be attended to and they were taken care of on the same day. I had an issue with heating in one of the bedrooms. The building maintenance person was kind to offer me a temporary room heater while he ordered the necessary part. He was prompt in returning to complete the work as soon as he had the parts in hand. The front desk people are also quite accommodating and friendly. The day I moved in the concierge offered me the use of his laundry card while I waited to get my own. The residents are very friendly and dispel the myth of the "rude New Yorker." Just this morning someone I shared an elevator with offered me a free bagel! Oh yeah, forgot . . . the city views are spectacular! I'm glad I live in Manhattan Park.

originalText.text: Terrible building dirty common spaces, very small gym and never cleaned. Apartments are cold as building is poorly isolated with everything falling apart. The towel racks that are falling down and water closets that are dripping. The kitchen has permanently scratched and dirty stove and furnitures are falling apart. The bathrooms are very old and destroyed, bath tube scratched. Above of everything there is growing number of social apartments and there is a lot of mentally sick people living in the building. They talk to you and harrasing you. If you have kids scary place to be.

originalText.text:
A family of 4, we lived at Manhattan Park for 10 years. The Manhattan Park leasing team has been a pleasure to have by our side, through various changes. Always understanding, considerate and professional, we were in great hands. Danielle, Tar and team, will greet you with smiling eyes and a will to help you find your sweet home. We highly recommend living at Manhattan Park complex, which is also located conveniently in front of a beautiful park and facing Manhattan and the river.
The supermarket is across the street, and there are 2 bus stops a few steps from the 4 building complex. The Manhattan park pool is top notch, and is a major plus. Summers at Manhattan Park pool and grass areas are magical. Danielle organizes outdoor halloween parties, pool parties and other events that the kids are always looking forward to, and will never forget! We are grateful and we will miss it all.

originalText.text: We live in Manhattan Park second year already. We love living here. Concierges and maintenance stuff very friendly and helpful. The leasing team is amazing!
